pull.title: build: upgrade depends Boost to 1.77.0
pull.body:
This primarily improves support for external signing, as it includes
multiple bugfixes for Boost Process. As well as various improvements to
the multi-index library.

#23340 rebased.

Guix build:

issue.title: build: upgrade to boost 1.77 to fix c++20 compilation
issue.body: I've been investigating compiling bitcoin core using C++20. It appears that our usage of boost requires boost 1.73 or above in order to compile using C++20 (compilation fails with any version lower than that). After initial review, it was recommended to bump boost to 1.77.

events.body:
> ??

Thanks, carryover from #23340. Already been done in #24301.

Since we only use the headers, review should be a lot easier.

Can you write up the most important changes or why this is needed?

issue.title: test: Remove suppression no longer needed with headers-only Boost.Test
issue.body: It appears, that moving to [headers-only](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24301) Boost.Test makes the removed suppression unneeded even without [bumping](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24383) boost version.

events.body:
> Remove now unneeded suppression.

It can be removed without Boost upgrade -- #24390.

issue.title: build: Fix Boost.Process check for Boost 1.73 and older
issue.body:
On master (5f44c5c428b696af4214b2519cb2bbeb0e4a1027) Boost.Process check false fails without the `-lpthread` flag.

```
$ grep -C 2 pthread_detach config.log 
/usr/bin/ld: /tmp/cczCQfQv.o: in function `boost::asio::detail::posix_global_impl<boost::asio::system_context>::~posix_global_impl()':
conftest.cpp:(.text._ZN5boost4asio6detail17posix_global_implINS0_14system_contextEED2Ev[_ZN5boost4asio6detail17posix_global_implINS0_14system_contextEED5Ev]+0xa3): undefined reference to `pthread_join'
/usr/bin/ld: conftest.cpp:(.text._ZN5boost4asio6detail17posix_global_implINS0_14system_contextEED2Ev[_ZN5boost4asio6detail17posix_global_implINS0_14system_contextEED5Ev]+0xc4): undefined reference to `pthread_detach'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
configure:26674: $? = 1
```

Not required for Boost 1.74+.

Bumping the depends version of Boost is fine by me. Maybe repeat the main motivation(s) from the original PR in the description.

I just updated non-depends Boost to 1.78 on my Mac, so I'll keep an eye on issues.

_Update_: found one, it complains that it can't find `Boost.Process`. But that's not a problem in this PR, because CI builds the external signer [just fine](https://cirrus-ci.com/task/6749556661551104). See #24413

> Bumping the depends version of Boost is fine by me. Maybe repeat the main motivation(s) from the original PR in the description.
> 
> I just updated non-depends Boost to 1.78 on my Mac, so I'll keep an eye on issues.
> 
> _Update_: found one, it complains that it can't find `Boost.Process`. But that's not a problem in this PR, because CI builds the external signer [just fine](https://cirrus-ci.com/task/6749556661551104). See #24413

Maybe re-track back to 1.77?
For some reason 1.77 was never released on Homebrew. Not sure if there was a deeper reason for that. But #24415 seems like a good enough workaround for 1.78

Concept ACK. I don't see why not.
Needs "version used" update in `doc/dependencies.md`?

verification.payload:
tree 396832a87475acaf874f195cabb92deffb11c209
parent c44e734dca64a15fae92255a5d848c04adaad2fa
author Pasta <pasta@dashboost.org> 1634938405 -0400
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1645545225 +0000

build: upgrade depends Boost to 1.77.0

This primarily improves support for external signing, as it includes
multiple bugfixes for Boost Process. As well as various improvements to
the multi-index library.

events.message:
build: upgrade depends Boost to 1.77.0

This primarily improves support for external signing, as it includes
multiple bugfixes for Boost Process. As well as various improvements to
the multi-index library.

events.body:
> Needs "version used" update in doc/dependencies.md?

I really hope this is the last boost bump for 23.0 :smile:
